goodResponse.fullResponse:
✮ JOHN 3:16 ANALYSIS

↗ Verse
• "For God so loved the world, that he gave his only begotten Son, that whosoever believeth in him should not perish, but have everlasting life." (John 3:16 KJV)
• "So loved" (Greek: houtos egapesen) - demonstrates the extent and intensity of God's love
• "Only begotten" (Greek: monogenes) - uniquely born, one of a kind Son
• "Believeth" (Greek: pisteuein) - ongoing trust and faith, not just mental agreement

↗ Historical Context
• Spoken by Jesus to Nicodemus around 30 AD during His earthly ministry
• Part of a nighttime conversation with a Pharisee seeking spiritual truth
• Jerusalem setting, addressing Jewish understanding of salvation
• Written by John the Apostle around 85-90 AD to prove Jesus is the Christ (John 20:31)

↗ Theological Doctrine
• Divine Love: God's agape love as the motivation for salvation
• Substitutionary Atonement: Jesus died in place of sinners
• Salvation by Faith: Belief in Christ as the only way to eternal life
• Universal Offer: "Whosoever" shows salvation available to all mankind
• Eternal Security: "Everlasting life" - permanent spiritual life with God

↗ Cross Reference
• Romans 5:8 - "But God commendeth his love toward us, in that, while we were yet sinners, Christ died for us"
• 1 John 4:9 - "In this was manifested the love of God toward us, because that God sent his only begotten Son into the world"
• Romans 6:23 - "For the wages of sin is death; but the gift of God is eternal life through Jesus Christ our Lord"
• Ephesians 2:8-9 - "For by grace are ye saved through faith... not of works"

↗ Summary
• John 3:16 presents the Gospel in its purest form - God's love motivated Him to provide salvation through Jesus Christ
• This verse establishes that eternal life is a gift received by faith, not earned by works
• It demonstrates God's heart for all humanity, regardless of background or status
• The practical application is to trust in Jesus Christ alone for salvation and eternal life
